skill.name: labarchive-integration
skill.description: Electronic lab notebook API integration. Access notebooks, manage entries/attachments, backup notebooks, integrate with Protocols.io/Jupyter/REDCap, for programmatic ELN workflows.
skill.summary: Programmatic integration with LabArchives electronic lab notebooks for research data management and automation.
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Legitimate LabArchives API integration skill. Static findings are false positives: markdown backticks flagged as shell execution, standard file operations flagged as reconnaissance, and legitimate API endpoints flagged as hardcoded URLs. No malicious patterns confirmed after code review.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at SKILL.md:39
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Backticks are markdown inline code syntax, not shell command execution. The code examples shown use bash/python syntax for documentation purposes only.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at references/api_reference.md:7
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Documentation file containing API examples. Backticks format code snippets in markdown documentation, not executable commands.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] blocker: Weak cryptographic algorithm at SKILL.md:3
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Markdown file line 3 contains no cryptographic code. Static scanner flagged documentation text mentioning encryption concepts. Actual Python code uses no weak crypto.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] filesystem: Path traversal sequence at scripts/notebook_operations.py:168
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Line 168 shows controlled output path generation with timestamp: output_path / filename. Paths are user-configurable but not derived from untrusted user input. Legitimate backup file naming.
Line 272 mentions 'encrypt configuration files' as a security best practice recommendation. This is legitimate advice for protecting credentials, not ransomware behavior.
Hardcoded URL is https://github.com/mcmero/labarchives-py - the official LabArchives Python client library repository. Not malicious C2 infrastructure.
Lines 58-59 check if file exists using Path.exists() for the upload_attachment function. Standard file validation before upload, not reconnaissance.

content.value_statement: Manage electronic lab notebooks programmatically. Automate data uploads, backup notebooks, and integrate with scientific tools like Jupyter and REDCap for research workflows.
actual_capabilities: Authenticate with LabArchives API using institutional and user credentials
List, backup, and restore notebooks with optional attachment inclusion
Create entries with text content and upload file attachments
Generate site reports for usage analytics and compliance
Integrate with Protocols.io, GraphPad Prism, SnapGene, and Geneious
Export Jupyter notebooks as LabArchives entries
limitations: Requires Enterprise LabArchives license with API access enabled
Rate limited to approximately 60 requests per minute per API key
File upload size limited to approximately 2GB per file
OAuth authentication requires separate LabArchives developer registration

use_cases.title: Automate Experiment Documentation
use_cases.description: Programmatically upload experimental data and images to electronic lab notebooks after each experiment run.

use_cases.title: Notebook Backup Management
use_cases.description: Schedule automated backups of all laboratory notebooks with timestamps for compliance and disaster recovery.

use_cases.title: Analysis Export Workflows
use_cases.description: Connect sequence analysis tools like Geneious and SnapGene to LabArchives for integrated documentation.

prompt_templates.title: List My Notebooks
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all LabArchives notebooks I have access to with their IDs and my access level for each.

prompt_templates.title: Backup Notebook
prompt_templates.prompt: Backup my LabArchives notebook with ID NOTEBOOK_ID to a local file including all attachments.

prompt_templates.title: Upload Experiment Data
prompt_templates.prompt: Upload my experimental data file results.csv to LabArchives notebook NOTEBOOK_ID as a new entry titled Experiment Results.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Upload Directory
prompt_templates.prompt: Upload all files from my local directory ./experiment_data/ to LabArchives notebook NOTEBOOK_ID entry ENTRY_ID.

output_examples.input: Backup my LabArchives notebook with ID 67890 to include all attachments

best_practices: Store API credentials in environment variables or secure config files, never in source code
Implement 1-2 second delays between API calls to respect rate limits
Verify backup file integrity and completeness after each backup operation
anti_patterns: Do not commit config.yaml with credentials to version control systems
Avoid uploading sensitive data without verifying LabArchives access permissions first
Do not exceed recommended API rate limits as this may result in throttling

faq.question: What credentials do I need for LabArchives API access?
faq.answer: You need institutional API credentials from your LabArchives administrator and an external applications password from your account settings.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without an Enterprise license?
faq.answer: No. API access requires an Enterprise LabArchives license. Contact your institution administrator to enable API access.

faq.question: How do I back up all my notebooks at once?
faq.answer: Use the notebook_operations.py script with the backup-all command and your authentication credentials.

faq.question: What file formats are supported for attachment uploads?
faq.answer: Supports documents, images, data files, scientific formats, and archives including PDF, CSV, HDF5, CIF, and 7Z.

faq.question: How do I integrate Jupyter notebooks with LabArchives?
faq.answer: Export Jupyter notebooks to HTML using nbconvert, then create LabArchives entries with the HTML content as the entry body.

faq.question: What happens if my API rate limit is exceeded?
faq.answer: LabArchives will return HTTP 429. Implement exponential backoff and reduce request frequency to 60 requests per minute or less.
